title: Radiology Technologist - MRI/C-arm
description:
About the Role

We are seeking a talented Radiology Technologist - MRI/C-arm to join our team at RAYUS Radiology. As a key member of our imaging services team, you will be responsible for operating MRI and C-arm scanners to produce high-quality images of patients' bodies for diagnostic purposes.

Your primary focus will be on ensuring that patients receive accurate and timely diagnoses, while maintaining the highest standards of patient care and safety. You will work closely with radiologists and other healthcare professionals to achieve these goals.

Key responsibilities include:
• Performing routine and advanced MRI procedures
• Maintaining accurate patient records within the Radiology Information System (RIS)
• Cleaning and disinfecting equipment after each use
• Assisting with training new associates and providing technical expertise

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for career advancement and professional growth.

title: Advanced Diagnostic Radiology Technologist - Neurosurgery
description:
Description

This is a full-time Advanced Diagnostic Radiology Technologist position located at our outpatient Neurosurgery (S-Clarizz Blvd). The hours will be Monday - Friday 8a-5p. No call, weekend or holidays required!

Sign-on bonus available to eligible applicants!

Performs diagnostic radiographic procedures for radiological diagnosis, in a timely fashion, while demonstrating the appropriate knowledge and skills necessary to work with patients from pediatric through geriatric. Follows physician's instructions, prepares and operates equipment and positions patients correctly in order to record the requested diagnostic images. Displays leadership characteristics by volunteering for improvement initiatives and intra/interdepartmental committees, seeking new ways to improve team collaboration and success, functioning as a subject matter expert, and acting as a mentor to assist in team development and coaching. Advanced responsibilities may include acting as an onboarding/orientation preceptor, serving as clinical instructor for students, providing and leading annual CE opportunities for team members, acting as the operations leader during the absence of a team lead/supervisor.
• Basic Life Support certification, required.
• Requires active status as a Registered Technologist - Radiography, RT(R) through the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT).
• Requires current Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH) license as Radiologic Technologist.
• 3-5 years experience as a radiology diagnostic technologist, preferred.
• Requires ability to maneuver equipment and improvise positions when the condition of the patient does not permit routine positioning.

We are looking for team members who are passionate about challenging and significant work for the good of every patient. We are searching for individuals who are compassionate, serve with a purpose, are dedicated to supporting their team, and who seek excellence every day.

Sound like a perfect match? Apply now - we can't wait to hear from you!

#LI-Onsite

title: Radiology Technologist - MRI/C-arm
description:
About the Role

We are seeking a talented Radiology Technologist - MRI/C-arm to join our team at RAYUS Radiology. As a key member of our imaging services team, you will be responsible for operating MRI and C-arm scanners to produce high-quality images of patients' bodies for diagnostic purposes.

Your primary focus will be on ensuring that patients receive accurate and timely diagnoses, while maintaining the highest standards of patient care and safety. You will work closely with radiologists and other healthcare professionals to achieve these goals.

title: Team Lead-Imaging Services
description:
Description

As the largest orthopedic and specialty group in the southern region, we proudly serve Monroe and the surrounding communities. We are dedicated to the professional and personal development of our employees and take pride in the workplace culture we have cultivated. At IU Health United Medical Group Orthopedics & Sports Medicine, we are committed to embodying our values in our everyday actions. Our goal is to ensure that every interaction with patients, families, and visitors is meaningful. We invite you to join our incredible team and become a part of our shared values!

This is a full-time Team Lead-Imaging Services position located at our Orthopedic clinic in Bloomington. The hours are 8a-5p M-F.

Sign-on bonus available to eligible applicants!

Plans the work flow and employee distributions within the department. Provides various lead functions within the department while providing functional guidance to staff. Ensures staff interacts with patients and others in a positive manner and are competent to care for patients from pediatric through geriatric. Success is accomplished by promoting a team-oriented and service conscious environment.
• Basic Life Support certification required. May also require Advanced Life Support certification, if applicable.
• Requires active status through one of the following: American Registry of Radiology Technology (ARRT), American Registry of Diagnostic Medical Sonographers (ARDMS), Nuclear Medicine Technology Certification Board (NMTCB), American Registry of Magnetic Resonance Imaging Technologists (ARMRIT), or Cardiovascular Credentialing International (CCI), as required per specific modality.
• Requires current Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH) license as Radiologic Technologist or Nuclear Medicine Technologist, as required per specific modality.
• Requires ability to maneuver equipment and improvise positions when the condition of the patient does not permit routine positioning.
• 2-4 years of experience, per specific modality, preferred.

We are looking for team members who are passionate about challenging and significant work for the good of every patient. We are searching for individuals who are compassionate, serve with a purpose, are dedicated to supporting their team, and who seek excellence every day.

Sound like a perfect match? Apply now - we can't wait to hear from you!

#LI-Onsite

title: Imaging Technologist - CT Scan
description:
Job Description
A Computed Tomography (CT) technologist plays a vital role in medical imaging, working closely with physicians and other healthcare professionals to provide high-quality diagnostic services. As a CT technologist, your primary responsibility will be to operate complex CT scanners to produce accurate and detailed images of the body.

Key Responsibilities:
• Administer contrast materials and position patients to capture the necessary images.
• Prepare and operate the CT scanner to ensure optimal image quality, adhering to strict safety protocols.
• Collaborate with radiologists and other healthcare professionals to ensure accurate diagnoses and effective treatment plans.
• Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in CT scan technology and best practices, participating in ongoing education and training opportunities.

Working at Maple Grove Hospital
Our hospital is committed to fostering a positive and supportive work environment, where teamwork and collaboration thrive. As a member of our team, you will have access to ongoing training and professional development opportunities, helping you grow and succeed in your career.

title: Diagnostic Imaging Technologist
description:
Detailed Job Description:

The Diagnostic Imaging Technologist role at RAYUS Radiology involves operating advanced medical imaging equipment, including MRI and C-arm scanners, to produce high-quality diagnostic images.
Key Responsibilities:
• Perform imaging procedures with precision and accuracy
• Maintain patient records and adhere to safety protocols
• Collaborate with healthcare professionals to ensure seamless patient care

If you possess strong technical skills and a passion for delivering exceptional patient experiences, we invite you to explore this opportunity further.

title: Sonographer - Patient Care and Medical Imaging
Medical Imaging Technician
description:
Requirements
• Hold active ARRT certification, demonstrating expertise in CT scanning and imaging procedures.
• Possess current BLS certification, obtained within the last six months, and maintain continuous renewal.
• Be able to safely and efficiently operate various medical equipment, including CT scanners, patient transfer devices, security systems, fire alarms, three-dimensional workstations, emergency equipment, power injectors, PCs, and printers.
• Be willing to train and maintain competencies in new technologies and procedures.
